Ketamine Dosage

by Erowid


                    Context:

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.

Category: CHEMICALS

                    Text: 
                    CHEMICALS

ketamine



New, Vintage, and Signed Blotter Art

Contribute $50 or more and get a piece of displayable blotter art. These look great framed on the wall !

Ketamine Dosage

by Erowid

Ketamine Hydrochloride is most commonly used as a veterinary anaesthetic. It is generally injected intramuscularly, but can also be taken orally, rectally, or snorted. Much of the ketamine used recreationally is diverted from legitimate pharmaceutical sources in liquid form. Powdered ketamine is usually the result of drying liquid ketamine. Food should not be consumed within an hour and one-half before ketamine use, and should be avoided for longer periods of time if possible as nausea and vomiting are not uncommon. As always, it should be noted that dosages and reactions vary greatly depending on the individual. Following are charts showing approximate ketamine dosages in mg (by administration type).

Nasal / Insufflated Oral Rectal Intra-Muscular


                    Context: 
                    This section is from Erowid's ketamine information page within the Chemicals section, providing an overview of recreational and medical ketamine use, especially detailing dosage information and administration methods such as nasal (insufflated), oral, rectal, and intramuscular routes. It serves as an introduction to more specific dosing charts and safety considerations for ketamine use.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Nasal / Insufflated Oral Rectal Intra-Muscular

Insufflated / Nasal Ketamine Dosages by body weight approx total Threshold .1 mg / lb 10 - 15 mg Light .15 mg / lb 15 - 30 mg Common .3 mg / lb 30 - 75 mg Strong .5 - .75 mg / lb 60 - 125 mg The K Hole 1 mg / lb 100 - 250 mg Onset : 5 - 15 minutes Duration : 45 - 60 minutes Normal After Effects : 1 - 3 hours


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides specific ketamine dosage guidelines for insufflated (nasal) administration, including threshold, light, common, strong, and "K Hole" doses by body weight, along with onset, duration, and after effect timelines. It is part of a broader Erowid guide detailing ketamine dosages and effects for different routes of administration (nasal, oral, rectal, intramuscular, intravenous) and general usage considerations.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Powder for nasal use are produced by gentle boiling off of solution. Nasal doses are highly unlinear next to oral and IM doses. The effects are quite different at low doses. A low dose nasally will be short and much different from a comparable oral dose. One method described with nasal use is to insufflate (snort) 25 mg in each nostril, wait 5 minutes and repeat until desired dosage is reached. Ketamine is often used in 'bumps' or small amounts of the powder insufflated from either a specialized micro-spoon, a specialized 'bullet', or eyeballed small piles. Bumps from bullets are commonly 30-50 mg, although their size varies by size of spoon, make of bullet, and individual. Users should be extremely careful when using a new method of sizing bumps. Ketamine dissolved in saline solution (usually at 10% concentration) is also used intranasally. Although racemic ketamine is occasionally prescribed medically in the United States as an adjunct to other pain management strategies, there is


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in the section detailing ketamine dosage methods, specifically under nasal/insufflated administration. It explains how powdered ketamine is prepared for insufflation, describes typical dosing practices and units ("bumps"), highlights the variance in effects compared to other administration routes, and mentions medical intranasal use. This follows the overall introduction to ketamine dosage, which breaks down dosing guidelines and effects by route (nasal, oral, rectal, intramuscular, intravenous) for both recreational and medical contexts.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    at 10% concentration) is also used intranasally. Although racemic ketamine is occasionally prescribed medically in the United States as an adjunct to other pain management strategies, there is no FDA-approved racemic ketamine nasal spray product and it must be produced by a compounding pharmacy for prescription use. Beginning in 2019, a nasal spray formulation of S-ketamine was approved in the United States for specific clinical indications.


                    Context: 
                    This passage explains the medical use of intranasal ketamine, noting the absence of an FDA-approved racemic ketamine nasal spray in the US and the 2019 approval of an S-ketamine nasal spray, and is part of a broader section detailing ketamine dosages, administration methods, and related safety information.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Oral Ketamine Dosages by body weight approx total Threshold .3 mg / lb 40 - 50 mg Light .6 mg / lb 50 - 100 mg Common .75 - 2 mg / lb 75 - 300 mg Strong 1.5 - 2.5 mg / lb 200 - 450 mg The K Hole 3 - 4 mg / lb 500 + mg Onset : 5 - 20 minutes (depending on stomach contents) Duration : 90 minutes Normal After Effects : 4 - 8 hours

Oral doses are prepared from a powder by placing the powder in a cup and pouring about 1 cm of hot water (tap should be ok) in it and stiring to solution. The remainder of the cup is filled with an acid such as orange juice. Ketamine itself tastes quite bad.

Rectal Ketamine Dosages by body weight approx total Threshold .3 mg / lb 40 - 50 mg Light .6 mg / lb 50 - 100 mg Common .75 - 2 mg / lb 75 - 300 mg Strong 1.5 - 2.5 mg / lb 200 - 450 mg The K Hole 3 - 4 mg / lb 500 + mg Onset : 5 - 20 minutes Peak : 30 - 60 minutes Duration : 1 - 2 hours Normal After Effects : 1 - 4 hours


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides detailed dosage guidelines and preparation methods for oral and rectal administration of ketamine, including threshold, light, common, strong, and "K hole" dose ranges by body weight, along with onset, duration, and after effects. It appears within the broader Erowid ketamine dosage guide, which compares dosing, effects, and administration techniques across nasal, oral, rectal, intramuscular, and intravenous routes for both recreational and medical use, emphasizing harm reduction and individual variability.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    Some who choose the rectal administration route use a syringe with the needle removed. The desired dosage can be put in the syringe, inserted (using lubricant) and injected. Rectal use is similar to oral in that it has a lower peak, but longer duration.

I.M. Ketamine Dosages by body weight approx total Threshold .1 mg / lb 10 - 15 mg Light .15 mg / lb 15 - 30 mg Common .2 mg / lb 25 - 50 mg Strong .5 mg / lb 40 - 100 mg The K Hole .75 mg / lb 60 - 125 mg Anaesthetic 1 mg / lb 100 - 200 mg Onset : 1 - 5 minutes (depending on dose and injection location) Duration : 30 - 60 minutes Normal After Effects : 2 - 4 hours


                    Context: 
                    This chunk appears in Erowid’s Ketamine Dosage Guide, specifically within the section outlining recommended dosages and administration methods. It transitions from detailing rectal ketamine use—including preparation and effects—directly into intramuscular (IM) dosage guidelines, providing approximate amounts by body weight and summarizing onset, duration, and after-effects for IM administration.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    It is common to have muscle pain when injecting larger doses of liquid Ketamine into muscle tissue. The pain can continue for several days if it is not administered properly. The muscle soreness can be somewhat controlled by using a very fine needle (25-29 gauge) and by injecting very slowly. Too large a needle (low gauge) is painful. Too small a needle (high gauge) is too delicate and can bend. [Thanks to 2020 contributors who have helped us improve our info about preferred gauges.) It should take 10-30 or more seconds to inject a dose into a muscle. If you feel it begin to sting, slow down the injection rate. IM and IV administration generally produce a higher peak, and a shorter overall duration than other methods.

I.V. Ketamine Dosages Anaesthetic 1 - 4.5 mg/kg body Onset : 1 - 4 minutes (depending on dose and injection location) Duration : 30 - 60 minutes Normal After Effects : 2 - 4 hours


                    Context: 
                    This passage appears in the Ketamine Dosage section and discusses intramuscular (IM) ketamine injection techniques, emphasizing needle gauge, injection speed, and pain management. It transitions into intravenous (IV) ketamine dosing, providing typical anesthetic dosage ranges, onset, duration, and after effects, as part of Erowid’s comprehensive guide to ketamine administration methods and their effects.

Drug: Ketamine | cid: 3821
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on Ketamine dosage.
Erowid name: ketamine
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Dose

                    Text: 
                    I.V. Ketamine Dosages Anaesthetic 1 - 4.5 mg/kg body Onset : 1 - 4 minutes (depending on dose and injection location) Duration : 30 - 60 minutes Normal After Effects : 2 - 4 hours

Although some recreational users do inject ketamine I.V., it is uncommon to inject ketamine intravenously. It is commonly used medically for surgical anaesthesia via IV. The book 'Introduction to Pharmacology' by 'Mary Kaye Asperheim and Justin Favaro' 12th edition chapter 12. Page 107.

Every individual reacts differently to every chemical. Know your Body - Know your Mind - Know your Substance - Know your Source. Erowid's dosage information is a summary of data gathered from users, research, and other resources and should not be construed as recommendations.  Individuals can respond differently to the same dosage.  What is safe for one can be deadly for another. Start low with new substances. Have trusted companion/guide/sitter/friend present and/or available.

Revision History #


                    Context: 
                    This section provides intravenous (IV) ketamine dosage guidelines and cautions, situated within a comprehensive ketamine dosage guide by Erowid. The document outlines dosing ranges, onset, duration, and aftereffects for multiple administration routes (nasal, oral, rectal, intramuscular, intravenous), and emphasizes individual variability and harm reduction practices.
